pages.text:
Become a Zoo Member!
Experience the wonder of nature with unlimited visits to one of the top 10 zoos in the United States. With so many reasons to visit throughout the year, your initial cost of membership quickly pays for itself. As a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, we receive no recurring government funding for operations. Your purchase of a membership enables us to continue to serve our community with vital animal, conservation and education programs.
Join Now
Renew
Get E-card
Membership Terms and Conditions
Membership benefits are applicable only to individuals covered by membership. All benefits subject to change. Photo ID required for all named adults. Memberships are nonrefundable and nontransferable and are valid one year from purchase date. All memberships auto renew one year from purchase,
7-10 days prior to the expiration date. You will receive a reminder email prior to the renewal.
Standard Level
Admission
Unlimited visits for named members during normal zoo operating hours
Early admission for members at 9 AM and $3 off guest admission
Reduced admission to more than
120 zoos and aquariums.
Adventures
50% off Expedition Africa Kayak Tours, subject to blackout dates* and availability
50% off all Treetop Trek Adventure courses, subject to blackout dates* and availability
*Blackout dates include: Brevard County School’s Spring Break in March and Thanksgiving and Winter Breaks (includes weekends before and after).
Discounts
$5 to $30 OFF select camps and education programs
10% discount on most merchandise and concessions
Special member days celebration
Get closer with discounts on select animal encounters
Community
Biweekly emails about Zoo animals and activities
Access to our members-only Facebook group
Preferred Level
All Benefits Listed Above +
UNLIMITED train rides
$5 OFF on additional
guest admissions

Join Now
Renew
Plus Plan +1 Guest Per Visit
Add the Plus Plan to your membership to bring one unnamed guest FREE per visit!
A named adult member must be present for guest entry.
$70  per plus plan
Renew My Membership
Continue to enjoy unlimited access to your zoo and support critical conservation efforts.
Renew
Get E-Card
Gift a Membership
Show you care for conservation. Give them a gift of visiting the Zoo all year long to explore animal, education and conservation opportunities.
Memberships start immediately upon purchase and are valid for one year.
Gift
Adopt An Animal
By adopting an animal ($50), you help provide essential care, food, and enrichment for our Zoo residents. Your virtual adoption makes a difference in the lives of our animals and supports our conservation efforts. Join us in making a positive impact today!
Adopt
For Our Most Dedicated Friends
Annual Gifts of $1,000 or more
As a Jaguar Society Member, you are among Brevard Zoo’s most committed supporters. You’ll gain invitations to behind-the-scenes tours, sneak peek experiences and special presentations. Joining the Jaguar Society, you’ll receive the benefits of a family membership plus complimentary train rides, kayaking, giraffe and bird feedings; (10) one-day guest passes; (10) one-day VIZ guest passes and more!
Join Jaguar Society
Membership Terms and Conditions
Membership benefits are applicable only to individuals covered by membership. Photo ID required for all named adults. All benefits subject to change. Memberships are nonrefundable and nontransferable and are valid one year from purchase date. All memberships auto renew one year from purchase,
7-10 days prior to the expiration date. You will receive a reminder email prior to the renewal.

Bold Murals | New Murals on Display Now!
Bold Murals is an expressive art exhibition exploring how nature brings us joy. Full of energy and color, discover the next chapter of our gallery this summer.
LEARN MORE
Florida Residents: Kids Free September | September 1 - 30
During the whole month of September, kids 11 years of age and younger receive
FREE Zoo admission
when accompanied by a paying adult who is a Florida resident.
Learn More
Happy Hour: Bold Murals Edition | September 4 | 5:30 - 7:30 PM
Sip, socialize, and celebrate art and wildlife! This 21+-only, limited-ticket event lets you explore the Bold Murals exhibition after hours while enjoying up-close animal encounters, live music and yard games, live painting by our animal residents (yes, really!), meet-the-artist opportunities, bold signature cocktails and mocktails (your first drink included) and light appetizers.
LEARN MORE
Family Program: Behind the Tracks | September 6, 7, 20 and 21 | 9:15 – 10:15 AM
Ever wonder what keeps the Zoo train chugging along? Go behind the tracks for a special look at the inner workings of the Cape to Cairo Express!
LEARN MORE
Adult Program: Adult Trivia Challenge | September 13 | 6 - 8 PM
Put your knowledge to the test in this lively trivia challenge featuring brain-teasing questions about animal behavior, Zoo history, conservation and more – perfect for curious minds and competitive spirits alike!
Learn More
Teacher Open House | September 17 | 5:30 – 7:30 PM
Teachers, join us for a special evening just for you! Connect with over 30 educational organizations and businesses from across Central Florida as you enjoy a night of mixing and mingling with fellow educators.
LEARN MORE
Nature Preschool Open House | September 26 | 9AM - 12 PM & 1 - 4 PM
Families interested in our Nature Preschool are invited to attend an open house. Children must be 3 years old and able to use the bathroom independently to be eligible.
Learn More
Brevard Zoo Legacy Classic | September 22
A day of golf has never been so
w
ild
! Up to 120 golfers will tee off as foursomes playing in a traditional scramble format.
LEARN MORE
Adult Program: Photography Series | September 27, February 28 & April 25
Whether you are a seasoned photographer or a new photography enthusiast, enjoy unprecedented access to the Zoo’s animals in this photography workshop series. Covering a new topic during each workshop, our experienced instructor will teach you how to work with challenging lighting conditions and optimize your camera’s settings during this brand-new series.
Learn More
Boo at the Zoo | Saturdays & Sundays in October | 10 AM - 3 PM
Get ready for a spooktacular time as our beloved family-favorite Halloween activity returns as a daytime event!
Learn More
Family Program: Night Prowl | October 4 | 5 - 7:30 PM
Get ready for a wild night of family-friendly frights during this spooky after-hours adventure at the Zoo!
LEARN MORE
Family Program: Monster Mash and Splash | October 18 | 4:30 – 7 PM
Join us for a spooky, splash-tacular time in Paws On! This family-friendly, after-hours program features splash pad fun and hands-on spooky science experiments.
LEARN MORE
Adult Program: Animal Oddities and Curiosities | October 11 | 5 - 7 PM
Uncover the strange and spectacular side of nature this spooky season! Explore animal oddities, investigate bones and skulls and discover the strange science that makes the animal kingdom so unique while you create your own cabinet of curiosities.
Learn More
Jazzoo | November 8 | 7 - 11 PM
Get ready for our all-inclusive annual music and food extravaganza, Jazzoo, where every moment is a celebration!
Tickets on sale now.
LEARN MORE
Adult Program: Overnight | November 15 | 6 PM – 9 AM
Leave the kids at home and experience the ultimate overnight adventure safari at the Zoo! Explore after dark, soar on a night zipline and enjoy experiences behind-the-scenes. Includes pizza, breakfast and next-day Zoo admission. Unforgettable memories await!
Learn More
Adult Program: Fall Camp | November 29 & 30 | 9 AM – 3 PM, daily
Who says Zoo camp is just for kids? This two-day experience is packed with hands-on animal encounters, classic camp games with a Zoo spin, creative nature crafts and behind-the-scenes adventures you won’t find on a regular visit. Camp t-shirt included!
Learn More
Florida Residents: Senior Discount December | December 1 - 24
During this period, senior Florida residents aged 65+ can enjoy
$10 Zoo admission.
Learn More
Kids’ Holiday Hang Out | December 5 | 5 - 8 PM
While you check off your holiday to-do list, drop your kids off at the Zoo for an evening of festive fun!
LEARN MORE
Adult Program: Birding (Offsite) | December 13 | 10 AM - 12 PM
Step into the field and join us for a guided birding adventure beyond the Zoo!
Learn More
End div.left-content

Jazzoo
End div#bottom-content
REFUND POLICY
No refunds will be issued once a ticket is purchased.
No refunds or rain checks will be issued due to inclement weather. The Zoo is an outdoor facility with little indoor space.
Please plan your trip to the Zoo accordingly based upon the anticipated weather conditions for that day.
No refunds will be issued to anyone removed from the Zoo for failure to follow the
Rules of the Wild
.
Please make sure you read and understand our refund policy.

WAYS TO SUPPORT YOUR ZOO
Brevard Zoo is an independent, non-profit organization that receives no recurring government funding for our operating costs. Your generous support enables us to continue to serve our community and continue our vital animal wellness, education and conservation programs.
2022 IMPACT REPORT
2021 IMPACT REPORT
OUR LEGACY CAMPAIGN
Help make our future plans for Brevard Zoo, plus the Future Bowen Aquarium, a reality.
LEARN MORE
WAYS TO GIVE
Choose from several ways to give that assists in the care of our animals and experienced team members.
WAYS TO GIVE
OUR PARTNERS
We’re proud to recognize the generous corporations, foundations and government supporters that fuel our impact with their philanthropy.
JOIN US
JAGUAR SOCIETY
Forge the Zoo’s future through deeper engagement with us.
JOIN NOW
INTERNSHIPS
We are proud to mentor students through our internship programs.
INTERNSHIPS
VOLUNTEER
Participate in adult, group and teen volunteer opportunities.
VOLUNTEER

Extraordinary Venues
Your Wedding and Event Destination
When you’re looking for a unique venue to host your next event, choose the lush natural surroundings of Brevard Zoo. Where else do you have the possibility of giraffe grazing or otters swimming playfully at your event? With an indoor facility and multiple outdoor spaces, there is enough configurations to fit almost any event size.
Venues
Experiences
Weddings
Corporate
Celebration
Nyami Nyami River Lodge
This 3,000-square-foot indoor and outdoor space features air conditioning, A/V capabilities, Wi-Fi, a podium, tables, chairs and private restrooms. The centerpiece of this exquisite venue is a covered veranda overlooking our picturesque giraffe habitat. This space can be set for multiple event types for an elegant dinner on the veranda, a grand wedding and it is also great for fundraising and corporate events.
Capacity Recommendation
Seated Event: 225  |  Cocktail Style: 275
Lion Lookout
Our Lion Lookout offers a lion’s eye view into this species’ habitat located in Expedition Africa. This versatile space is ideal for hosting a variety of events, including receptions, corporate gatherings and intimate ceremonies. It combines a beautiful outdoor setting with an unforgettable backdrop for your special occasion. You may even have a “special guest” or two at your event!
Capacity Recommendation
Ceremony: 40 | Cocktail Style: 80
Lands of Change
This venue features an expansive outdoor space. In the early evening, the space is warmed by the soft light of the setting sun and in the evening, market lights twinkle under the stars. Imaging taking center stage for your event in front of the dramatic white bird of paradise. This space can be set for multiple event types and has useful electrical options for dramatic additional lighting and A/V capabilities.
Capacity Recommendation
Seated Event: 72  |  Cocktail Style: 150 | Ceremony Only: 100
Rainforest Revealed
Guests walk to this venue under a canopy of green, leafy foliage, crossed by our skytrails that are frequented by the spider monkeys. Imagine arriving at this intimate outdoor space with otters and Amazonian fish swimming along the edges of your reception. The venue is perfect for small- to medium-sized events with more than enough space for a bar, buffet and an area for high-top table reception.
Capacity Recommendation
Cocktail Style: 150  |  Ceremony Only: 40
Paws On
This spacious, open-air venue has a history of hosting many successful Jazzoo events. The space has a natural flow around the reflection pool that lets individuals flow easily between groups networking. The south end of the venue has an elevated area that works as a stage, naturally giving height and a clear line of site to those throughout Paws On.
Capacity Recommendation
Seated Event: 50 | Cocktail Style: 150
